Description

Processing astronomical images results in large catalogs of sources on the sky. These catalogs often come from repeated measurements of a patch of sky, sometimes in different wavelength bands or under different conditions. In order to compare measurements of the same object, these catalogs have to be cross-matched by their sky positions, a non-trivial calculation involving spherical geometry. Various codes currently exist to perform this cross-matching, but they cannot be easily used to match catalogs stored as Astropy Tables. The goal of this project is to build a user-friendly Astropy interface on top of an existing n-way matching algorithm, to allow cross-matching of millions of objects in a few seconds or less.
